channel.title: Server startup error
channel.description:

item.title: Server startup error
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[31/12/12 12:12 PM]: java.sql.SQLException: null, message from server: "Host '174.118.245.39' is not allowed to connect to this MySQL server"

I’m going to go ahead and assume you’re not allowed to connect to that MySQL server.

If you don’t know what to do from there, let Google help you out:
http://www.thegeekstuff.com/2010/08/allow-mysql-client-connection/

[quote=“www.thegeekstuff.com”]If you want to allow a specific client ip-address (for example: 192.168.1.4) to access the mysql database running on a server, you should execute the following command on the server that is running the mysql database.

[code]$ mysql -u root -p
Enter password:

mysql> use mysql

mysql> GRANT ALL ON . to root@‘192.168.1.4’ IDENTIFIED BY ‘your-root-password’;

mysql> FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
[/code][/quote]

Read full topic
